intro: Hieracium erythropodum subsp. nigratum, commonly known as the black hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy, upright stems and basal leaves that are heart-shaped and often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow, with a dark central disk, and it produces small, oval-shaped achenes as its fruit. The subspecies is distinguished by its dark, almost black, central flower disk, which gives it its common name.
